description:
Even if you install all the ipykernel requirements shows only Nodejs kernel
But if you use the image file from the site it works just fine
The version in the store is faulty
you can't use the python kernel , even you install all the requirements , ni think will change
summary: you can't use the python kernel

description:
Great project but the one they got here is outdated. go to https://nteract.io/ and download the AppImage.

then go to https://github.com/AppImage/appimaged and run the AppImage daemon. after that just but the nteract image to $home/AppImages the daemon should make it as an app.
summary: just download the AppImage from their website

description: I don't like developing notebooks with nteract, but it's a nice way to view and present notebooks

i thought this app only existed in appimage,but actually it sat down here. thank you snapd.
the ultimate jupyter alternative
